bullets.text: Fed’s G.17 annual revision updates industrial production and capacity utilization, potentially reshaping views on manufacturing momentum and output gaps.
Xi presses Trump on Taiwan; leaders agree to April China summit, signaling tentative thaw with stakes for trade, supply chains, and defense posture.
U.S. and Ukraine hail progress on peace framework with Russia; Kyiv balances sovereignty concerns with Trump’s involvement ahead of talks.
Amazon pledges up to $50B to build AI infrastructure for U.S. government, cementing hyperscaler role in federal compute and bolstering domestic AI capacity.
SanDisk joins S&P 500 after Western Digital spinoff, replacing Interpublic; index changes trigger passive flows and potential volatility.
BlackRock’s iShares Bitcoin fund sees record withdrawals as crypto heads for worst month since 2022, pressuring digital-asset sentiment.
Ozempic-maker Novo Nordisk’s Alzheimer’s trial misses key endpoint; shares plunge, tempering GLP-1 neuro hopes while obesity franchise remains intact.
Automakers advance rare-earth-free motor tech, reducing reliance on Chinese magnets and reshaping EV supply chains and cost structures.
Anthropic unveils Claude Opus 4.5 with Chrome and Excel integrations, intensifying AI platform competition and enterprise productivity use-cases.
Trump installs Commerce overseers for U.S. Steel under ‘golden share’ deal with Nippon, entrenching state influence over strategic steel assets.
Asia-Pacific equities track Wall Street tech rebound after Alphabet-led AI rally, lifting Nikkei, Hang Seng and Kospi.
TSMC Arizona outage halted fab operations, reportedly scrapping Apple wafers; underscores risks in U.S. semiconductor onshoring ramp.
CRISPR-engineered wheat that fixes its own nitrogen could slash fertilizer use, emissions and costs, boosting yields and food security.
Sleep apnea associated with significantly higher Parkinson’s risk, suggesting screening and treatment could modify long-term neurodegenerative outcomes.
